item.title: Text Processing and Searching
item.description: grep # Introduction to grep # grep stands for “Global Regular Expression Print.” It is a powerful command-line utility used for searching plain-text data for lines that match a regular expression. grep is widely used for searching specific patterns within files and outputting the matching lines. Basic Syntax # grep [options] pattern [file...] pattern: The string or regular expression to search for. [file...]: The file(s) to search. If no files are specified, grep searches the input provided from the standard input.
